channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day
item.description:
Sunday, September 29, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support National Police Remembrance Day.

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Australian Women in Music Awards
item.description:
Monday, September 30, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Australian Women in Music Awards.

The Australian Women in Music Awards highlights the achievements of women in the Australian music industry, and their contribution to the nighttime economy.

This Light Up is organised by: Cicada International

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Seniors Month
item.description:
Tuesday, October 1, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink and Purple with Sparkle to celebrate Queensland Seniors Month.

The Queensland Government- Seniors and Carers in partnership with Council on the Ageing (COTA) Queensland, are jointly committed to advancing the rights, needs, interests, and futures of people as we age.

Our vision is that ageing in Queensland is a time of possibility, opportunity and influence, particularly in this month-long celebration for our beloved Queensland Seniors, that will bring together people of all ages, cultures and abilities.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs, in partnership with COTA

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Go Dotty Day
item.description:
Wednesday, October 2, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Go Dotty Day.

Our nationally recognized "Go Dotty Day" on 2nd October annually, raises awareness of Ladybird Care Foundation and the support we provide to bereaved parents. The date, 2nd October coincides with the birthday of Emma Pascoe, daughter of founders of Ladybird Care Foundation. Emma passed away just before her 18th birthday and is the inspiration for Ladybird Care Foundation.

This Light Up is organised by: Ladybird Care Foundation Ltd

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: German Day of Unity and German Week
item.description:
Thursday, October 3, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Black Red and Yellow to celebrate German Day of Unity and German Week.

Brisbane German Week 2024 will be highlighting each of the above-mentioned connections creating a warm experience for the community in a fortnight events series starting on the 1st of October. The German National Day "Day of German Unity" on the 3rd of October is one of the highlights of Brisbane German Week. This day celebrates the day when East and West Germany were reunited after the cold war. As about 20,000 Germans call Queensland home, we strive to continue to promote the strong connections between Queensland and Germany.

The German Consulate is the initiator of Brisbane German Week which has been an ongoing event since 2016, even during the pandemic. The event raises awareness of Queensland's strong German connections: social, cultural, educational, economic, political and scientific connections.

This Light Up is organised by: the Honorary Consul of the Federal Republic of Germany

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Recovered Futures Art Exhibition
item.description:
Friday, October 4, 2024

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to support Recovered Futures Art Exhibition.

The Recovered Futures Art Exhibition raises awareness during Mental Health Week. The event has been running in Brisbane for 33 years, and supports approximately 150 artists with a lived experience of mental illness to showcase and sell their artwork.

This Light Up is organised by: Richmond Fellowship Queensland

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

The Recovered Futures Art Exhibition raises awareness during Mental Health Week. The event has been running in Brisbane for 33 years, and supports approximately 150 artists with a lived experience of mental illness to showcase and sell their artwork.
This Light Up is organised by: Richmond Fellowship Queensland

item.title: World Meningitis Day
item.description:
Saturday, October 5, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Meningitis Day.

World Meningitis Day is an international day dedicated to raising awareness of Meningitis and the devastating effect it has on families and their loved ones. The Meningitis Centre Australia is a national organisation who aims to defeat Meningitis, Meningococcal, Pneumococcal and other related diseases through awareness, education, and community support.

This Light Up is organised by: Meningitis Centre Australia Inc.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Light It Red for Dyslexia
item.description:
Sunday, October 6, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Light It Red for Dyslexia.

Code REaD Dyslexia Network presents our 9th annual 'Light it Red for Dyslexia' campaign, designed to Raise Dyslexia Awareness by lighting significant monuments, buildings and landmarks RED during Dyslexia Awareness Month each October. #LIR2023 is set to make history with close to 100 structures across Australia participating in this year's light up event, making it the largest 'Light Up' ever in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Code Read Dyslexia Network Australia Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: headspace Day
item.description:
Monday, October 7, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Lime Green to support headspace Day.

headspace Day is an annual event dedicated to raising awareness about youth mental health and encouraging young people to take steps to improve their wellbeing. This year headspace Day will be celebrated across Australia on the 9th of October and aims to promote mental health literacy, reducing stigma, and encouraging young people to seek help when needed. The day serves as a reminder of the importance of mental health and the resources available to support young people in their mental health journey.

This year, headspace Day is encouraging people to 'pause, reflect, reconnect' - reminding young people and their families that it can be helpful to slow down and take time to do something positive for their mental health and wellbeing. Headspace supports young people, from 12-25, who are going through a tough time. We assist young people in four key areas of Physical Health (incl. sexual health), Mental Health, Alcohol and Other Drugs, Work and Study Support. Our headspace centres, online services, and programs offer a range of support to help young people in achieving and maintaining a healthy headspace.

This Light Up is organised by: Stride Mental Health Ltd

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Polio Awareness Month
item.description:
Tuesday, October 8, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Polio Awareness Month.

October is Polio Awareness Month, and we particularly focus our awareness activities throughout this month. Our theme colour is orange, and we are aiming to get as many significant places as possible across Australia illuminated to help us raise awareness.

This Light Up is organised by: Polio Australia Incorporated

item.title: Eve of Firefighters Remembrance Day
item.description:
Wednesday, October 9, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate the Eve of Firefighters Remembrance Day.

Queensland Fire Department respectfully acknowledges the fallen firefighters on Firefighter Remembrance Day on October 10. This day marks the heroism, courage and bravery shown by firefighters across Australia. Landmarks will be lit in red to honour our fallen, and show the respect the community has for the brave and courageous firefighters as we head into a potentially catastrophic fire season.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Fire Department

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of Firefighters Remembrance Day
item.description:
Wednesday, October 9, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate the Eve of Firefighters Remembrance Day.

Queensland Fire Department respectfully acknowledges the fallen firefighters on Firefighter Remembrance Day on October 10. This day marks the heroism, courage and bravery shown by firefighters across Australia. Landmarks will be lit in red to honour our fallen, and show the respect the community has for the brave and courageous firefighters as we head into a potentially catastrophic fire season.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Fire Department

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Mental Health Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 10, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple and Green to support World Mental Health Day.

Queensland Mental Health Week is an annual awareness initiative that aims to shine a spotlight on individual and community mental health and wellbeing, increase awareness of mental health challenges, and celebrate the contribution of the mental health and community sectors. It is held around World Mental Health Day (October 10), which aims to raise awareness of mental health issues around the world.

This Light Up is organised by: CheckUp Australia and Mental Illness Fellowship of Australia

item.title: Anti Poverty Week
item.description:
Sunday, October 13, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and White to support Anti Poverty Week.

Anti-Poverty Week supports the Australian community to have an increased understanding of poverty and to take action collectively to end it. For over half a century, The Brisbane Coffee Brigade has provided food, compassion and connections to Brisbane’s homeless. This Anti Poverty Week draws attention to the estimated 40,000+ Queenslanders that are homeless, a heartbreaking statistic. Unfortunately, homelessness is rapidly rising, due to rent affordability, the cost-of-living crisis and mental health issues, and as such the needs of the homeless are acute. The Brisbane Coffee Brigade provides a critical service to the Brisbane’s homeless, with sandwiches, drinks, ancillary goods and the priceless gift of conversation to those in need. Our Vision is ‘Always striving to alleviate hunger’. A service that is done with compassion to an incredibly marginalised part of society, every day of the year, come rain, hail or pandemic.

This Light Up is organised by: Ecumenical Coffee Brigade

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Helena's House
item.description:
Sunday, October 13, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal and Gold to support Helena's House.

Helena McIlwain passed away on the 13th of October 2019 from a pulmonary embolism. Helena worked in disabilities while studying biomedical science at QUT. Her dream was to to be in the medical world so she could help and support people with a disability. A house will be named in her honour. Helena's House. A unique space where our young people will practice independent living skills and develop the emotional resilience needed to gradually transition from the family home to a life of their choice, with people they know. Helena’s House will support our children’s essential next step on their path to a more independent life – one that is safe, secure and guaranteed.

This Light Up is organised by: Best Life Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Carers Week
item.description:
Monday, October 14, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support National Carers Week.

National Carers Week is an opportunity to raise community awareness among all Australians about the diversity of carers and their caring roles.
This Week runs from Sunday 13 to Saturday 19 October 2024 with the Theme: ‘Millions of Reasons to Care’. The Week aims to broaden the awareness of the 3 million Australians caring for their family members and friends, as Carers represent a diverse range of cultures, ages, experiences and responsibilities, but all of them balance of caring responsibilities with other responsibilities like work, study and their physical and mental health.

This Light Up is organised by: Carers Queensland Ltd

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day
item.description:
Tuesday, October 15, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue and Pink to support International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day.

International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Day is an opportunity to remember the little ones held dearly in our hearts. The campaign runs for the entire month of October, however, is marked on 15th October with the Wave of Light. Whatever time zone you are in at 7pm on the 15th of October, light a candle in remembrance of all the babies gone too soon.

This Light Up is organised by: Pregnancy and Infant Loss Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Veterans Mental Health Week
item.description:
Wednesday, October 16, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and White to support Veterans Mental Health Week.

This year, Veterans' Health Week (VHW) is being held from 13 to 20 October 2024 with the theme 'Keep Connected'. This theme aims to promote good health and wellbeing in the everyday life of veterans and families, and shines a spotlight on the importance of social connectedness.

item.title: 40 Years of Women's Legal Service
item.description:
Thursday, October 17, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to celebrate 40 Years of Women's Legal Service.

WLSQ is proudly created and run by women for women, since 1984. For Her, With Her - Commemorating 40 years of Women's Legal Service Queensland. WLSQ is committed to a society where every woman:
  • can live free from violence and discrimination.
  • can tell her story, have it heard and respected, without judgement.
  • receives a just and equitable outcome from legal and social systems.
This Light Up is organised by: Women's Legal Service

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International DLD Day
item.description:
Friday, October 18, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support International DLD Day.

The DLD Project Foundation aims to be the peak Developmental Language Disorder (DLD) body in Australia whose principal activity is to support individuals with DLD and their families in order to reduce the impact of this hidden disability. DLD affects 1 in 14 people. International #DLDday on Friday 18th October 2024 aims to raise awareness of DLD, a hidden but common disability. 

This Light Up is organised by: The DLD Project Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: War Widows Day
item.description:
Saturday, October 19, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support War Widows Day.

The annual War Widows Day, officially acknowledged by the Queensland Government in 2022, aims to increase awareness about the array of resources and support accessible to war widows and widowers. Additionally, it stands as a poignant reminder of the profound loss experienced by the families and friends of those who have served Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian War Widows Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City

item.title: Children's Rights Week
item.description:
Sunday, October 20, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Teal to support Children's Rights Week.

Children’s Week is an annual event celebrated in Australia. A diverse range of events and activities are organised at National, State and Local levels to celebrate the rights of children to enjoy childhood and for the wider community to rejoice in their talents, skills and abilities. To learn more visit: https://childrensrightsqld.org.au/

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Rights Queensland

item.title: International Mastocytosis & Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day
item.description:
Monday, October 21, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support International Mastocytosis & Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day.

The International Mastocytosis & Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day aims to spread the word about a family of diseases that range from moderately disruptive to life-threatening forms. This annual awareness day is the result of a collaborative decision made by 24 mast cell disease advocacy groups, with the first Day commemorated in 2018. It represents the one day in the year to direct attention to these rare diseases. A day that will bring mast cell organisations together to highlight the impact of the diseases in patients’ lives and the importance of research and education in the acceptance of diversity. It aims to raise awareness and understanding of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, and further investments in research. A day that will lift up the hopes of mast cell patients all over the world in dreaming of a brighter future. The #SpotOurSpots campaign is the Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand initiative for the Awareness Day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

It aims to raise awareness and understanding of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, and further investments in research. A day that will lift up the hopes of mast cell patients all over the world in dreaming of a brighter future. The #SpotOurSpots campaign is the Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand initiative for the Awareness Day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

This annual awareness day is the result of a collaborative decision made by 24 mast cell disease advocacy groups, with the first Day commemorated in 2018. It represents the one day in the year to direct attention to these rare diseases. A day that will bring mast cell organisations together to highlight the impact of the diseases in patients’ lives and the importance of research and education in the acceptance of diversity. A day that will lift up the hopes of mast cell patients all over the world in dreaming of a brighter future. item.title: International Stuttering Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, October 22, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support International Stuttering Awareness Day.

International Stuttering Awareness Day is to raise awareness about stuttering which affects 1% to 5% of the population, equating to 25k to 125k in Brisbane and 250k to 1.25M within Australia. STUTTA, trading as the Australian Stuttering Association, exists to encourage and empower people who stutter to embrace their individual journeys. Our vision is a world in which people who stutter are given the space, time, and opportunity to speak.

This Light Up is organised by: STUTTA

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Sexual Violence Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, October 23, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Teal to support Sexual Violence Awareness Month.

October is Sexual Violence Awareness Month in Qld - SVAM. For 2024 Qld is focusing on 'SURVIVOR VOICES' as the theme for the month. The colour for SVAM is TEAL - teal ribbons, banners, shirts, cupcakes...... whatever helps raise attention. SVAM is a time for everyone in the community to focus on supporting survivors of sexual violence. it is also importantly, a time to reflect on this issue which is so widely experienced and consider what we as individuals, groups, and organisations, can do to help change the incidence of sexual violence. How can each and every one of us contribute to a change in attitude and actions - creating a safer, more respectful and aware community? How do we honour, hear and learn from, SURIVOR VOICES? Banners on landmarks and the colour TEAL, help to remind us all about this month. So keep an eye out around BRISBANE for banner sightings and splashes of TEAL. #SVAM 2024

This Light Up is organised by: Zig Zag Young Women's Resource Centre

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
